additional_citations: Mallet, M. A. & Lee, R. W. 2006. Identification of three distinct Polytomella lineages based on mitochondrial DNA features. J. Eukaryot. Microbiol., 53:79-84; Smith, D. R., Hua, J. & Lee, R. W. 2010. Evolution of linear mitochondrial DNA in three known lineages of Polytomella. Curr. Genet., 56:427-438.
primary_citation: Pringsheim, E. G. 1955. The genus Polytomella. J. Protozool., 2:137?145.
other_collection_site_info: Cambridge, artificial garden basin in Shelford
importance: Polytomella parva is non-photosynthetic, naturally-wall-less unicellular green alga closely related to Chlamydomonas reinhardtii. A Polytomella transcriptome project will improve our understanding of photosynthesis and its associated reactions, further our knowledge of the evolutionary consequences of losing photosynthetic capabilities and increase the research potential of transcriptome sequences that are available from other chlorophyte algae.
